channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA

item.title: Report E-2025040128
item.description:
Report E-2025040128

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-07
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L RACING, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 7, 2025, two (2) 1-gallon pails of UN3149 were damaged due to unknown reasons and released approximately one (1) quart to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizers, absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the trailer. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040130
item.description:
Report E-2025040130

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-07
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 7, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was damaged at a previous terminal and released approximately five (5) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents, hand tools, and a power washer to remediate the impacted areas. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040064
item.description:
Report E-2025040064

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-02
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 2, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was damaged and released approximately thirty-five (35) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted areas. All impacted materials were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums. The damaged drum of product was containerized in one (1) 85-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report E-2025030469
item.description:
Report E-2025030469

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-26
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/26/2025, at 12:57 hours, FRA Inspector Quinton Grant reported PROX 280006, a loaded tank car containing acetone, was leaking from the top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the Shipper, Advansix, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025-03-26-00144). Marion Environmental Inc (MEI), a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the liquid line leaking between the base of the liquid line valve and tank car’s pressure plate. MEI personnel were able to tighten the liquid line valve mounting bolts and stop the release. Contractor personnel verified the car built 6 psi of pressure in the tank car and remained leak free. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Jeffery Matlack (804-530-6285). The tank car was delivered to Whitaker Industries with the approval from FRA Inspector Kevin Cash.
